comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -1623,8 +1628,8 @@ private String generatePerBrokerConfiguration(NodeRef node, KafkaPool pool, Map<
                                 namespace,
                                 node,
                                 listeners,
-                                listenerId -> advertisedHostnames.get(node.nodeId()).get(listenerId),
-                                listenerId -> advertisedPorts.get(node.nodeId()).get(listenerId)
+                                listenerId -> Optional.ofNullable(advertisedHostnames.get(node.nodeId())).orElse(Map.of()).get(listenerId),
+                                listenerId -> Optional.ofNullable(advertisedPorts.get(node.nodeId())).orElse(Map.of()).get(listenerId)
comment.body:
Just thinking about the readability of this line ...

AFAIU, you get `advertisedHostnames` as empty map so the `get(node.nodeId())` returns null (so you got the NPE when trying to look for the listenerId). Now, you are using this null to create an nullable `Optional` which because is null, is replaced by a `Map.of()` on which you look for listenerId which of course returns null.
I find this really hard to read/understand.

Why not just a simple:

```java
advertisedHostnames.size() != 0 ? advertisedHostnames.get(node.nodeId()).get(listenerId) : null
```

But again it's my personal preference. Let's see what others think.

comment.body: @scholzj @ppatierno In the latest commit, we fixed the system tests that failed with NPE. I added a comment explaining the fix, hope that make sense. When you get a chance, can you please trigger the system tests again?

issue.title: [ST] Refactor - Rename systemtest class Constants to TestConstants
issue.body:
### Type of change
- Refactoring

### Description

In the STs like AbstractUpgradeST, we encountered importing more constant classes named Constants. Specifically, we were using the same class from different modules, which might lead to potential conflicts and confusion.
To address this, this PR includes renaming our Constants class in systemtest module to something more descriptive and less likely to cause naming conflicts with other classes. This renaming should help maintain code clarity and avoids unintended conflicts, ensuring that our code won't be confusing.

Additionally, this PR also adjusts all of these import statements - all of its ocurences.

### Checklist

- [ ] Write tests
- [ ] Make sure all tests pass
- [ ] Update documentation
- [ ] Check RBAC rights for Kubernetes / OpenShift roles
- [ ] Try your changes from Pod inside your Kubernetes and OpenShift cluster, not just locally

comment.body: I think, `isController` was actually clearer than `isCombined` or `isCombinedNode`. `KafkaBrokerConfigurationDiff` class is only called for brokers which is obvious from the name and `isController` returning true suggests that this broker is also a controller, that's all we care about when ignoring properties.

commits.message:
Use PEM certificates when connecting to KafkaAgent REST endpoint (#9288)

Signed-off-by: Gantigmaa Selenge <tina.selenge@gmail.com>

issue.title: [Enhancement]: Use PEM certificates when connecting to KafkaAgent's REST endpoint
issue.body:
### Related problem

KafkaRoller currently uses PKCS12 certificates when connecting to KafkaAgent's REST endpoint to learn about broker state. 

### Suggested solution

We should implement using PEM certificates instead of PKCS12 because it is easier to use and more Kubernetes-friendly format. It may be easier for future work around certificate management. 

### Alternatives

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body:
> Or would it make more sense to write system test instead that connects to kafka agent with mutual TLS so that we are testing the whole flow?

Well, the mTLS is used all the time, so it does no need new STs I think. I guess the `decodePemPrivateKeyFromSecret` would be easy to unit test. But you are right that relying on the ST makes probably sense.

comment.body: sorry to be pedantic. I always find double "negative" hard to understand. You are negating `controller` and then calling the variable with a `Not`. Tbh I would have `boolean isController = nodeRef.controller()` and then using the appropriate logic in the method where it's passed.

comment.body: Tbh I think it's a personal preference, I am used to reason more in milliseconds than seconds so for me it's easier to make a mistake that these are 60 ms than 60 seconds. But as I said it's personal. Anyway I would be consistent with the rest of the codebase using milliseconds everywhere. We could discuss this and change in a different PR.
